name: Guess the Musical Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the lead male character in "Carousel"?
questions.explanation:
Billy.

	Billy Bigalow is the lead in "Carousel".  Billy is a barker for a carousel. He meets Julie Jordan and they get married. He then loses his job and they live off of her aunt Nettie. However, when he finds out that Julie is going to have a child, he wants to have money for the child. Not knowing how to make an honest living anymore, he decides to steal money with Jigger.However, when the cops come, he doesn't want to go to jail and falls onto his own knife killing himself. Then he is up in heaven trying to prove he is good enough to get in, by helping his daughter Louise. This was a Rogers and Hammerstein musical.

questions.text: A famous radio duo: one was named Andy, what was the other's name?
questions.explanation:
Amos.

	"Amos and Andy" was a radio comedy show. After TV was invented they moved from radio to TV.

questions.text: What is the square root of 289?
questions.explanation:
17.

	The square root of a number is the number when multiplied by itself gives you a square. For example: the square root of 4 is 2 because 2x2=4.  The square root of 289 is 17 because 17x17=289.

questions.text: What is the name of Ethel's husband on "I Love Lucy"?
questions.explanation:
Fred.

	Fred Mertz was played by William Frawley. He also played Bub O'Casey on "My Three Sons". Fred and Ethel were the landlords and best friends of Ricky and Lucy.

questions.text: What profession did Edgar Bergen have?
questions.explanation:
ventriloquist.

	Edgar Bergen is the father of "Murphy Brown" star Candace Bergen. He was one of the most famous ventriloquists of all time. His most famous dummy is Charlie McCarthy.

Hungary.

	Eva Gabor was born in Budapest, Hungary on February 11, 1919. She is best known for her role as Lisa Douglas on "Green Acres". She died in 1995 and her older sister Magda died two years later in 1997. Their sister Zsa Zsa Gabor died in 2016.

questions.text: Complete the lyric from "Teddy Bear" by Elvis Presley. "I don't wanna be a ________ cause ___________ play too rough."
questions.explanation:
tiger, tigers.

	Elvis was born in Tupelo, Mississippi on January 8, 1935.  The song "Teddy Bear" was the song that Jesse, Danny, and Joey sang to Michelle on "Full House" as her lullabye at bedtime. Jesse was a huge Elvis fan. As Stephanie once put it, "His lip curls because he thinks he's Elvis."

questions.text: Which person in the Bible lived to the oldest age?
questions.explanation:
Methuselah.

	Methuselah lived to be 969 years old according to the Bible. "And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died" (Gen 5:27; King James Version)

questions.text: Which of these is a more polite way of saying that someone farted?
questions.explanation:
passed gas.

	Ever wonder what a fart was made of? I found this answer at www.ifarted.com. A fart is composed of: Nitrogen, Oxygen, carbon dioxide, Hydrogen and methane. The rest of these components are much smaller amounts, but they are what causes the fart to smell: methyl-indol, skatole, hydrogen sulfide, methyl-mercaptan

questions.text: What is the musical that answers 1-9 have in common?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	All the answers relate to Kander and Ebb's musical "Chicago". BILLY Flynn is the lead male character in "Chicago". AMOS is the name of Roxie's husband. Velma killed her husband and sister becuase she caught them "doing number 17, the spread eagle." FRED Casley is the man that Roxie killed because he wanted to end the affair they were having. Billy has Roxie sit on his lap doing a VENTRILOQUIST act using her as a dummy in "We Both Reached for the Gun".  Hunyak, the only one of the girls to get hung, was from HUNGARY. In "We Both Reached for the Gun" Roxie claims she fought Fred "like a TIGER." In "Razzle Dazzle" one of the lines is "Not since the days of old METHUSELAH." In "Class" Mama sings "No one says oops when they're PASSING THEIR GAS."  This is my first common bond quiz. Please tell me what you think.
